newsitem.title: NIGERIA: Rights activists say Nigeria denies visas.
newsitem.headline: Rights activists say Nigeria denies visas.

text.p: Nigeria's military government has refused to give visas to four human rights activists, including Amnesty International's Secretary-General Pierre Sane, their local affiliates said on Tuesday.
The activists planned to visit Nigeria in November to mark a year since the execution of author Ken Saro-Wiwa and eight other minority rights activists accused of murder.
The local branch of Amnesty International said the activists applied for visas in February.
"Denying visas to human rights activists and continued human rights violations are inconsistent with the much vaunted democratisation process of the government," it said in a statement.
Government officials declined to comment on the issue.
